foreignNames.name: Ginete Brutal Urrante
foreignNames.text: Raide — Quando Ginete Brutal Urrante entra no campo de batalha, você perde 4 pontos de vida, a menos que você tenha atacado com uma criatura neste turno.

foreignNames.name: Ревущий Всадник-Громила
foreignNames.text: Набег — Когда Ревущий Всадник-Громила выходит на поле битвы, вы теряете 4 жизни, если только в этом ходу вы не атаковали существом.

foreignNames.name: 嚎吼巨兽骑士
foreignNames.text: 突击～当嚎吼巨兽骑士进战场时，除非你于本回合中曾以生物攻击，否则你失去4点生命。

foreignNames.name: 嚎吼巨獸騎士
foreignNames.text: 突擊～當嚎吼巨獸騎士進戰場時，除非你於本回合中曾以生物攻擊，否則你失去4點生命。

cards.originalText: Raid — When Bellowing Saddlebrute enters the battlefield, you lose 4 life unless you attacked with a creature this turn.

cards.name: Bitter Revelation
cards.text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"Here you lie then, Ugin. The corpses of worlds will join you in the tomb."
—Sorin Markov

foreignNames.name: Bittere Offenbarung
foreignNames.text: Schaue dir die obersten vier Karten deiner Bibliothek an. Nimm zwei davon auf deine Hand und lege den Rest auf deinen Friedhof. Du verlierst 2 Lebenspunkte.
foreignNames.flavor: „Hier liegst du also, Ugin. Die Trümmer ganzer Welten werden dir im Grab Gesellschaft leisten." —Sorin Markov

foreignNames.name: Revelación amarga
foreignNames.text: Mira las cuatro primeras cartas de tu biblioteca. Pon dos de ellas en tu mano y el resto en tu cementerio. Pierdes 2 vidas.
foreignNames.flavor: "Así que aquí yaces, Ugin. Los cadáveres de varios mundos te acompañarán en la tumba". —Sorin Markov

foreignNames.name: Amère révélation
foreignNames.text: Regardez les quatre cartes du dessus de votre bibliothèque. Mettez deux d'entre elles dans votre main et le reste dans votre cimetière. Vous perdez 2 points de vie.
foreignNames.flavor: « C'est donc ici que tu reposes, Ugin. Les dépouilles des mondes te rejoindront dans la tombe. » —Sorin Markov

foreignNames.name: Amara Rivelazione
foreignNames.text: Guarda le prime quattro carte del tuo grimorio. Aggiungine due alla tua mano e metti le altre nel tuo cimitero. Perdi 2 punti vita.
foreignNames.flavor: "Dunque è qui che giaci, Ugin. I cadaveri di molti mondi ti seguiranno nella tomba." —Sorin Markov

foreignNames.name: 苦々しい天啓
foreignNames.text: あなたのライブラリーの一番上から４枚のカードを見る。そのうち２枚をあなたの手札に加え、残りをあなたの墓地に置く。あなたは２点のライフを失う。
foreignNames.flavor: 「ここに眠るか、ウギンよ。じきに世界の遺体がお前とともにこの墓に葬られることになるだろう。」 ――ソリン・マルコフ

foreignNames.name: 씁쓸한 깨달음
foreignNames.text: 당신의 서고 맨 위의 카드 네 장을 본다. 그 중 두 장을 당신의 손으로 가져가고 나머지는 당신의 무덤에 넣는다. 당신은 생명 2점을 잃는다.
foreignNames.flavor: "우진, 이곳에 잠들어 있었구나. 이제 모든 차원의 시체들이 네 곁을 지킬 것이다." —소린 마르코프

foreignNames.name: Revelação Amarga
foreignNames.text: Olhe os quatro cards do topo do seu grimório. Coloque dois deles em sua mão e o restante em seu cemitério. Você perde 2 pontos de vida.
foreignNames.flavor: "Então aqui está você, Ugin. Os cadáveres de mundos inteiros se juntarão a você no túmulo." — Sorin Markov

foreignNames.name: Горькое Осознание
foreignNames.text: Посмотрите четыре верхние карты вашей библиотеки. Положите две из них в вашу руку, а остальные — на ваше кладбище. Вы теряете 2 жизни.
foreignNames.flavor: «Вот где ты покоишься, Уджин. Трупы целых миров скоро лягут с тобой в одну могилу». — Сорин Марков

foreignNames.name: 苦涩启示
foreignNames.text: 检视你牌库顶的四张牌。将其中两张置于你手上，其余的牌则置入你的坟墓场。你失去2点生命。
foreignNames.flavor: 「乌金，原来你沉眠于此。众世界的残骸也将到墓中与你相聚。」 ～索霖马可夫

foreignNames.name: 苦澀啟示
foreignNames.text: 檢視你牌庫頂的四張牌。將其中兩張置於你手上，其餘的牌則置入你的墳墓場。你失去2點生命。
foreignNames.flavor: 「烏金，原來你沉眠於此。眾世界的殘骸也將到墓中與你相聚。」 ～索霖馬可夫

cards.originalText: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put two of them into your hand and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 2 life.

cards.name: Bloodsoaked Champion
cards.text:
Bloodsoaked Champion can't block.
Raid — {1}{B}: Return Bloodsoaked Champion from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate only if you attacked this turn.
cards.flavor: "Death is merely another foe the Mardu will overcome."

rulings.text: The activated ability can be activated only if Bloodsoaked Champion is in your graveyard. Notably, if it attacks and then dies later in the turn, you can use its ability to return it to the battlefield, as its attack satisfies its own activation instruction.

Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn't matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn't have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn't have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

foreignNames.name: Blutbesudelter Champion
foreignNames.text:
Der Blutbesudelte Champion kann nicht blocken.
Überfall — {1}{B}: Bringe den Blutbesudelten Champion aus deinem Friedhof ins Spiel zurück. Aktiviere diese Fähigkeit nur, falls du in diesem Zug mit mindestens einer Kreatur angegriffen hast.
foreignNames.flavor: „Der Tod ist lediglich ein weiterer Widersacher, den die Mardu überwinden werden."

foreignNames.name: Campeón ensangrentado
foreignNames.text:
El Campeón ensangrentado no puede bloquear.
Incursión — {1}{B}: Regresa el Campeón ensangrentado de tu cementerio al campo de batalla. Activa esta habilidad solo si atacaste con una criatura este turno.
foreignNames.flavor: "La muerte no es más que otro enemigo al que los Mardu vencerán".

foreignNames.name: Champion sanguinolent
foreignNames.text:
Le Champion sanguinolent ne peut pas bloquer.
Saccage — {1}{B} : Renvoyez sur le champ de bataille le Champion sanguinolent depuis votre cimetière. N'activez cette capacité que si vous avez attaqué avec une créature ce tour-ci.
foreignNames.flavor: « La mort n'est qu'un ennemi de plus que les Mardu vaincront. »

foreignNames.name: Campione del Bagno di Sangue

cards.name: Dead Drop
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Target player sacrifices two creatures.
cards.flavor:
Got a diving lesson
—Sultai expression meaning "was fed to the crocodiles"

rulings.text: Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
The target player chooses which creatures they will sacrifice as Dead Drop resolves. If the player controls only one creature at that time, they will sacrifice it.
Dead Drop doesn’t target any creature. The target player could sacrifice a creature with hexproof, for example.

The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.

cards.name: Empty the Pits
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Create X tapped 2/2 black Zombie creature tokens.
cards.flavor: The Sultai would rebuild the empire on the backs of the dead.

rulings.text: You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.

The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.

cards.name: Grim Haruspex
cards.text:
Morph {B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
Whenever another nontoken creature you control dies, draw a card.
cards.flavor: "We all want to know what's going on in someone else's head. I simply open it up and look."

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a mana value of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It's colorless and has a mana value of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn't use the stack and can't be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it's turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn't cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren't affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can't look at face-down spells or permanents you don't control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You're not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

cards.name: Krumar Bond-Kin
cards.text: Morph {4}{B} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: "The Abzan replaced my savagery with a noble heritage. I would give my life for my House."

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a converted mana cost of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It’s colorless and has a converted mana cost of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it’s turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn’t cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren’t affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can’t look at face-down spells or permanents you don’t control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You’re not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

cards.text:
Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield tapped.
Raid — When Mardu Skullhunter enters the battlefield, if you attacked this turn, target opponent discards a card.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn’t matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn’t have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn’t have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.name: Murderous Cut
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Destroy target creature.
cards.flavor: The blades of a Sultai assassin stab like the fangs of a dragon.

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

cards.name: Necropolis Fiend
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Flying
{X}, {T}, Exile X cards from your graveyard: Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

cards.name: Rite of the Serpent
cards.text: Destroy target creature. If that creature had a +1/+1 counter on it, create a 1/1 green Snake creature token.
cards.flavor:
"From your death, new life. From your loss, our profit."
—Kirada, Qarsi overseer

rulings.text: You get the Snake token no matter who controlled the target creature.
Rite of the Serpent won’t create more than one Snake token, even if the target creature had more than one +1/+1 counter on it.
If the creature is an illegal target as Rite of the Serpent tries to resolve, Rite of the Serpent won’t resolve and none of its effects will occur. You won’t get a Snake token.
If Rite of the Serpent resolves but the creature isn’t destroyed (perhaps because it has indestructible or it regenerated), you’ll get a Snake token if the creature has a +1/+1 counter on it.

foreignNames.flavor: 「献汝之命，创吾之生。取汝之失，为吾之得。」 ～卡尔西督军基拉妲

foreignNames.name: 巨蛇儀式
foreignNames.text: 消滅目標生物。如果該生物上有+1/+1指示物，則將一個1/1綠色的蛇衍生生物放進戰場。
foreignNames.flavor: 「獻汝之命，創吾之生。取汝之失，為吾之得。」 ～卡爾西督軍基拉妲

cards.originalText: Destroy target creature. If that creature had a +1/+1 counter on it, put a 1/1 green Snake creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Rotting Mastodon
cards.flavor: Mastodons became extinct long ago, but foul forces of the Gurmag Swamp sometimes animate their decaying remains. The Sultai happily exploit such creatures but consider them inferior to their own necromantic creations.

foreignNames.name: Verwesendes Mastodon
foreignNames.flavor: Mastodonten sind längst ausgestorben, doch faulige Kräfte des Gurmag-Sumpfes hauchen ihren Überresten manchmal neues Leben ein. Die Sultai unterwerfen solche Kreaturen gerne, betrachten sie aber als minderwertig im Vergleich zu ihren eigenen nekromagischen Schöpfungen.

foreignNames.name: Mastodonte putrefacto
foreignNames.flavor: Los mastodontes se extinguieron hace mucho, pero las hediondas fuerzas del pantano Gurmag a veces reaniman sus restos putrefactos. Los Sultai no tienen reparos en aprovechar esas criaturas, pero las consideran inferiores a las creaciones de su propia nigromancia.

foreignNames.name: Mastodonte pourrissant
foreignNames.flavor: Les mastodontes sont éteints depuis bien longtemps, mais les viles forces du marais de Gurmag réaniment parfois leurs dépouilles putréfiées. Les Sultaï exploitent bien volontiers ces créatures, mais elles sont pour eux bien inférieures à leurs créations nécromantiques.

foreignNames.name: Mastodonte in Decomposizione
foreignNames.flavor: I mastodonti si sono estinti da tempo, ma le forze immonde della Palude di Gurmag talvolta ne rianimano i resti putrefatti. I Sultai sfruttano volentieri queste creature, ma le considerano inferiori alle proprie creazioni necromantiche.

foreignNames.name: 朽ちゆくマストドン
foreignNames.type: クリーチャー — ゾンビ・象
foreignNames.flavor: マストドンは大昔に絶滅したが、グルマグ沼の邪悪な力が時折その腐乱した死体を動かすことがある。スゥルタイは喜んでそのようなクリーチャーを活用するが、自分たちの屍術で生み出した創造物より低級なものであると認識している。

foreignNames.name: 썩어가는 마스토돈
foreignNames.flavor: 마스토돈은 오래전에 멸종했지만 거마그 늪의 더러운 기운이 종종 그 썩어가는 사체를 움직이곤 한다. 술타이는 이런 존재들을 달갑게 활용하면서도 자신들의 사령술로 부리는 존재들보다 못하다고 여긴다.

foreignNames.name: Mastodonte Apodrecido
foreignNames.flavor: Os mastodontes foram extintos há muito tempo, mas as forças vis do Pântano Gurmag às vezes reanimam os restos pútridos deles. Os Sultai exploram prontamente essas criaturas, mas as consideram inferiores às suas próprias criações necromânticas.

foreignNames.name: Гниющий Мастодонт
foreignNames.flavor: Мастодонты давно вымерли, но темная сила болота Гурмаг иногда оживляет их гниющие останки. Султайцы с радостью пользуются такими существами, однако считают их лишь жалкими подобиями творений своих собственных некромантов.

foreignNames.name: 腐臭乳齿象
foreignNames.flavor: 乳齿象很早之前就已灭绝，但谷尔玛沼泽的邪恶力量偶尔还会驱使它们的腐败残躯为己所用。苏勒台虽乐享其成，却不大以此为意；他们更偏好自己的死灵术造物。

foreignNames.name: 腐臭乳齒象
foreignNames.flavor: 乳齒象很早之前就已滅絕，但谷爾瑪沼澤的邪惡力量偶爾還會驅使它們的腐敗殘軀為己所用。蘇勒台雖樂享其成，卻不大以此為意；他們更偏好自己的死靈術造物。

cards.name: Ruthless Ripper
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Morph—Reveal a black card in your hand. (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Ruthless Ripper is turned face up, target player loses 2 life.

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a converted mana cost of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It’s colorless and has a converted mana cost of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it’s turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn’t cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren’t affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can’t look at face-down spells or permanents you don’t control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You’re not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

foreignNames.name: Unbarmherzige Schlitzerin
foreignNames.text:

Wenn die Unbarmherzige Schlitzerin aufgedeckt wird, verliert ein Spieler deiner Wahl 2 Lebenspunkte.

foreignNames.text:

Cuando la Desgarradora despiadada se ponga boca arriba, el jugador objetivo pierde 2 vidas.

foreignNames.name: Éventreuse impitoyable
foreignNames.text:

Quand l'Éventreuse impitoyable est retournée face visible, le joueur ciblé perd 2 points de vie.

foreignNames.text:

Quando la Squartatrice Spietata viene girata a faccia in su, un giocatore bersaglio perde 2 punti vita.

foreignNames.name: 無情な切り裂き魔
foreignNames.text:
接死
変異 ― あなたの手札にある黒のカードを１枚公開する。（あなたはこのカードを、{3}で２/２クリーチャーとして裏向きに唱えてもよい。これの変異コストで、これをいつでも表向きにしてよい。）
無情な切り裂き魔が表向きになったとき、プレイヤー１人を対象とする。そのプレイヤーは２点のライフを失う。

foreignNames.text:

무자비한 살인광이 앞면으로 뒤집히면, 플레이어를 목표로 정한다. 그 플레이어는 생명 2점을 잃는다.

Quando Estripadora Impiedosa é voltada para cima, o jogador alvo perde 2 pontos de vida.

foreignNames.text:

Когда Безжалостная Потрошительница переворачивается рубашкой вниз, целевой игрок теряет 2 жизни.

cards.name: Shambling Attendants
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Deathtouch (Any amount of damage this deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor:
"Let the world behold what becomes of those who defy us."
—Taigam, Sidisi's Hand

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

cards.name: Sultai Scavenger
cards.text:
Delve (Each card you exile from your graveyard while casting this spell pays for {1}.)
Flying
cards.flavor: Since they guard armies of walking carrion, Sultai aven are never far from a meal.

rulings.text: The rules for delve have changed slightly since it was last in an expansion. Previously, delve reduced the cost to cast a spell. Under the current rules, you exile cards from your graveyard at the same time you pay the spell’s cost. Exiling a card this way is simply another way to pay that cost.
Delve doesn’t change a spell’s mana cost or converted mana cost. For example, Dead Drop’s converted mana cost is 10 even if you exiled three cards to cast it.
You can’t exile cards to pay for the colored mana requirements of a spell with delve.
You can’t exile more cards than the generic mana requirement of a spell with delve. For example, you can’t exile more than nine cards from your graveyard to cast Dead Drop.
Because delve isn’t an alternative cost, it can be used in conjunction with alternative costs.

cards.name: Ainok Tracker
cards.text:
First strike
Morph {4}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
cards.flavor: Some ainok of the mountains are accepted among the Temur as trusted hunt-mates.

rulings.text: Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a mana value of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It’s colorless and has a mana value of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it’s turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn’t cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren’t affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can’t look at face-down spells or permanents you don’t control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You’re not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

rulings.text: You choose how many targets Arc Lightning has and how the damage is divided as you cast the spell. Each target must receive at least 1 damage.

cards.name: Arrow Storm
cards.text:
Arrow Storm deals 4 damage to any target.
Raid — If you attacked this turn, instead Arrow Storm deals 5 damage to that permanent or player and the damage can't be prevented.

rulings.text: Raid abilities care only that you attacked with a creature. It doesn’t matter how many creatures you attacked with, or which opponent or planeswalker controlled by an opponent those creatures attacked.

Raid abilities evaluate the entire turn to see if you attacked with a creature. That creature doesn’t have to still be on the battlefield. Similarly, the player or planeswalker it attacked doesn’t have to still be in the game or on the battlefield, respectively.

cards.name: Ashcloud Phoenix
cards.text:
Flying
When Ashcloud Phoenix dies, return it to the battlefield face down under your control.
Morph {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Ashcloud Phoenix is turned face up, it deals 2 damage to each player.

rulings.text: Once Ashcloud Phoenix returns to the battlefield face down, each player will know which face-down creature it is. You can’t mix up the positions of your face-down permanents to disguise this.
If Ashcloud Phoenix is face down, you can turn it face up for its morph cost, even if you didn’t cast Ashcloud Phoenix face down using its morph ability.
If Ashcloud Phoenix leaves the graveyard before its “dies” ability resolves, it won’t return to the battlefield.
Morph lets you cast a card face down by paying {3}, and lets you turn the face-down permanent face up any time you have priority by paying its morph cost.

The face-down spell has no mana cost and has a mana value of 0. When you cast a face-down spell, put it on the stack face down so no other player knows what it is, and pay {3}. This is an alternative cost.

When the spell resolves, it enters the battlefield as a 2/2 creature with no name, mana cost, creature types, or abilities. It’s colorless and has a mana value of 0. Other effects that apply to the creature can still grant it any of these characteristics.

Any time you have priority, you may turn the face-down creature face up by revealing what its morph cost is and paying that cost. This is a special action. It doesn’t use the stack and can’t be responded to. Only a face-down permanent can be turned face up this way; a face-down spell cannot.
Because the permanent is on the battlefield both before and after it’s turned face up, turning a permanent face up doesn’t cause any enters-the-battlefield abilities to trigger.

A permanent that turns face up or face down changes characteristics but is otherwise the same permanent. Spells and abilities that were targeting that permanent, as well as Auras and Equipment that were attached to the permanent, aren’t affected.
At any time, you can look at a face-down spell or permanent you control. You can’t look at face-down spells or permanents you don’t control unless an effect instructs you to do so.

You must ensure that your face-down spells and permanents can easily be differentiated from each other. You’re not allowed to mix up the cards that represent them on the battlefield in order to confuse other players. The order they entered the battlefield should remain clear. Common methods for doing this include using markers or dice, or simply placing them in order on the battlefield.
If a face-down permanent leaves the battlefield, you must reveal it. You must also reveal all face-down spells and permanents you control if you leave the game or if the game ends.

變身{4}{R}{R}（你可牌面朝下地施放此牌並支付{3}，將其當成2/2生物。可隨時支付其變身費用使其翻回正面。）

Flying
When Ashcloud Phoenix dies, return it to the battlefield face down.
Morph {4}{R}{R} (You may cast this card face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

cards.name: Barrage of Boulders
cards.text:
Barrage of Boulders deals 1 damage to each creature you don't control.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, creatures can't block this turn.
cards.flavor: Crude tactics can be effective nonetheless.

rulings.text: Barrage of Boulders deals damage only to creatures you don’t control as it resolves. However, the ferocious ability affects all creatures, including ones you control and ones that weren’t on the battlefield as Barrage of Boulders resolved.

Some ferocious abilities that appear on instants and sorceries use the word “instead.” These spells have an upgraded effect if you control a creature with power 4 or greater as they resolve. For these, you only get the upgraded effect, not both effects.
Ferocious abilities of instants and sorceries that don’t use the word “instead” will provide an additional effect if you control a creature with power 4 or greater as they resolve.

foreignNames.name: Felsbeschuss

Der Felsbeschuss fügt jeder Kreatur, die du nicht kontrollierst, 1 Schadenspunkt zu.

foreignNames.name: Bombardeo de rocas

foreignNames.name: Barrage de rochers

foreignNames.name: 石弾の弾幕

foreignNames.name: 낙석 더미
foreignNames.text:
낙석 더미는 당신이 조종하지 않는 각 생물에게 피해 1점을 입힌다.
흉포 — 당신이 공격력이 4 이상인 생물을 조종한다면, 생물들은 이 턴에 방어할 수 없다.
foreignNames.flavor: 조잡한 전술이라도 효과적일 수 있다.

foreignNames.name: Barragem de Pedregulhos
foreignNames.text:
Barragem de Pedregulhos causa 1 ponto de dano a cada criatura que você não controla.
Feroz — Se você controla uma criatura com poder igual ou superior a 4, as criaturas não podem bloquear neste turno.
foreignNames.flavor: Táticas rudimentares podem ser eficientes.

foreignNames.name: Град Булыжников
foreignNames.text:
Град Булыжников наносит 1 повреждение каждому существу не под вашим контролем.
Свирепость — Если вы контролируете существо с силой не менее 4, существа не могут блокировать в этом ходу.
foreignNames.flavor: Самая грубая тактика может оказаться весьма действенной.

foreignNames.name: 巨石齐落
foreignNames.text:
巨石齐落对每个不由你操控的生物各造成1点伤害。
威猛～如果你操控力量等于或大于4的生物，则生物本回合不能进行阻挡。
foreignNames.flavor: 战术虽然粗糙，却依然有效。

foreignNames.name: 巨石齊落
foreignNames.text:
巨石齊落對每個不由你操控的生物各造成1點傷害。
威猛～如果你操控力量等於或大於4的生物，則生物本回合不能進行阻擋。
foreignNames.flavor: 戰術雖然粗糙，卻依然有效。

cards.originalText:
Barrage of Boulders deals 1 damage to each creature you don't control.
Ferocious — If you control a creature with power 4 or greater, creatures can't block this turn.
